definition: Take property unlawfully from a person or place by force or threat of force.
sentence: The bank was robbed last night.

definition: Protected from or not exposed to danger or risk.
sentence: They felt safe at home.

definition: In an unsatisfactory, inadequate, or unsuccessful way.
sentence: He played badly in the game.

definition: A climbing or trailing woody-stemmed plant.
sentence: The vine grew rapidly up the wall.

definition: A low continuous vibratory sound, typically one made by a cat or vehicle.
sentence: The cat began to purr softly.

definition: Completed; finished.
sentence: He was done with his homework.

definition: Firm and dry.
sentence: The toast was golden and crisp.

definition: The front part of a person's head from the forehead to the chin.
sentence: She washed her face every morning.

definition: Coming immediately after the present one in order, rank, or space.
sentence: She will see the doctor next.

definition: Intend to convey or refer to a particular thing; signify.
sentence: What does this word mean?

definition: Very wet and soft.
sentence: The bread was soggy from the rain.

definition: A short, sharp sound as of a switch being operated or of two hard objects coming smartly into contact.
sentence: She heard a click when the door locked.

definition: A particular level of rank, quality, proficiency, or value.
sentence: He received a good grade on his test.

definition: The parts of a bird or insect that it uses for flying.
sentence: The bird spread its wings and flew.

definition: During the period of time preceding a particular event, date, or time.
sentence: She arrived before the meeting started.

definition: Involuntarily open one's mouth wide and inhale deeply due to tiredness or boredom.
sentence: He began to yawn after a long day.

definition: A dark red vegetable that is typically eaten cooked.
sentence: She added beets to the salad.

definition: A small thin branch of a tree or bush.
sentence: He broke a twig from the tree.

definition: A cat with a characteristic pattern of dark or light stripes.
sentence: They adopted a cute tabby kitten.

definition: A structure of bars or wires in which birds or other animals are confined.
sentence: The bird lived in a large cage.

definition: The fine soft curly or wavy hair forming the coat of a sheep or other animal.
sentence: She knitted a scarf from wool.

definition: A type of product manufactured by a particular company under a particular name.
sentence: She always buys the same brand of cereal.

definition: Material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances.
sentence: He wrote his notes on paper.

definition: Move or act with haste.
sentence: She had to hurry to catch the bus.

definition: During the period of time following an event.
sentence: They went out for dinner after the movie.
